title._content: Grain silos and view of Kingston

description._content: "Almost on the summit of a high hill, behind the Commissariat Stores are nine remarkable "silos", constructed by the convicts for storage of grain. These are "bottle-shaped" excavations, the upper park constructed of solid masonry, and the entrance so shaped that the apartment could be closed with a stone "cork", thus making the chamber airtight." - Norfolk Islands (historical and descriptive) Lantern Lecture by Frank Walker R.A.H.S., 1917. This image is part of a collection entitled 'Views of Norfolk Island', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/id/48441/#tab-home|colle... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
